intro: Chesneya polystichoides, commonly known as the mountain chesney, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant features a rosette of basal leaves that are covered in fine hairs, and it produces yellowish to reddish flowers in late summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, arid environments. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
